channel.title: Configs on Ryan Galliher
channel.description: Recent content in Configs on Ryan Galliher

item.description:
---
title: "Protocol 2025-W50: Base Building"
date: 2025-12-08
week_number: W50
tags: ["protocol"]

phase: "Base Building"
focus: "Triathlon technique and base building"
target_compliance: 85%

schedule:
  monday:
    type: "Recovery/Rest"
    desc: "Active recovery: 30-minute light walk, stretching, foam rolling. Focus on mobility and flexibility."
  tuesday:
    type: "Swim"
    desc: "Technique-focused swim: 800m (400m drills, 400m continuous swim). Focus on form and breathing."
  wednesday:
    type: "Strength"
    desc: "Lower body strength: Deadlift 3x5 @ 300lbs, Squat 3x5 @ 225lbs. Accessory work: 3 sets of 12 lunges, 3 sets of 12 glute bridges."
  thursday:
    type: "Bike"
    desc: "Indoor cycling: 60 minutes at Zone 2 intensity (HR 130-140). Focus on cadence (85-95 RPM) and form."
  friday:
    type: "Run"
    desc: "Easy run: 4 miles at Zone 2 intensity (HR <150). Focus on maintaining a comfortable pace and good form."
  saturday:
    type: "Brick Workout + Content Creation"
    desc: "Brick workout: 30-minute easy bike followed by 20-minute easy run. Focus on smooth transitions. Create content: Document the experience and share on Twitter and blog."
  sunday:
    type: "Long Run"
    desc: "Long run: 6 miles at Zone 2 intensity (HR <150). Clear schedule, focus on endurance and mental toughness."

training_goals:
  - "Build a solid foundation in swimming and cycling technique."
  - "Maintain running base while gradually increasing volume."
  - "Preserve strength gains with consistent lower body workouts."

startup_goals:
  - "Complete 6+ hours of deep work on startup MVP."
  - "Ship one piece of content reflecting on the training and startup journey."
  - "Primary goal 1 is to complete in the 6+ hours is to touch up the UI bug fixes."
  - "Primary goal 2 is to complete auto fixer PR agent MVP."
  - "Primary goal 3 is to build agentic rag for the system."

content_strategy:
  theme: "Transitioning to Triathlon: Week 1 Insights"
  posts:
    - platform: "Twitter"
      status: "Planned"
      topic: "First impressions of swim and bike training."
    - platform: "Blog"
      status: "Draft"
      topic: "Balancing triathlon training with startup development."

targets:
  cardio_volume:
    swim: "800m"
    bike: "60 minutes"
    run: "10 miles"
  strength:
    - "Deadlift 3x5 @ 300lbs"
    - "Squat 3x5 @ 225lbs"
  startup:
    - "6+ hours of deep work"
  recovery:
    - "7+ hours of sleep per night"
---

## ðŸ¤– AI Rationale

This protocol is designed to establish a solid foundation for Ryan's transition into triathlon while maintaining his strength and supporting his startup goals. Given that this is the first week and there is no historical data, the focus is on building a base with a gradual increase in volume and a strong emphasis on technique. The schedule includes two strength sessions to ensure Ryan maintains his current PRs, which is crucial for long-term performance. The inclusion of a brick workout on Saturday provides a practical application of the skills learned and serves as a content creation opportunity. The long run on Sunday allows for building endurance and mental resilience, essential for both triathlon and startup success. The balance between triathlon training and deep work ensures that Ryan can sustain high performance across all areas.

## ðŸ§¬ Human Notes

I have some current back injuries so I think it's best to take a break from heavy lifts for now. 

Each day should include time to journal/reflect and learn new things and read. I understand that is a lot, but reflecting on my day help me builds on the next one. 

Weekly goals should be SMART and embedded in weekly outcomes. If one of my goals is not tied to a specific outcome, you should add a specific outcome that I can achieve and build on.

ðŸ§  AI AGENT INSTRUCTIONS

Hi agent! Your job is to help me live the best version of my life. This repository contains the logs of my days in simple text format.

Mission

Help me plan my weeks and days as a top 0.01% individual who excels across multiple domains simultaneously: triathlon training, startup building, ML/AI engineering, and content creation.

Current Focus

Primary: Triathlon training (swim/bike/run) while maintaining strength Secondary: Launch startup MVP + create content to dogfood the product
